tool.name: Normalization
tool.command: echo 'galaxy_params.json' && cat 'galaxy_params.json' && echo '' && python '$__tool_directory__/format_values.py' 'galaxy_params.json' 'cleaned_params.json' --bool-values input_in_log_counts add_label_to_pca color_histogram_by_group set_min_max_for_x_axis_for_histogram interactive_plots plot_corr_matrix_heatmap save_plots --list-values samples_to_rename samples_to_include && echo 'cleaned_params.json' && cat 'cleaned_params.json' && echo '' && mosuite normalize_counts --json=cleaned_params.json

param.name: moo_input_rds
param.label: MOO input Rds
param.help: File path to read the input multiOmicDataSet object (MOO)

param.name: moo_output_rds
param.label: MOO output Rds
param.help: File path to output the multiOmicDataSet object (MOO) as an Rds file at the end of the function

param.name: count_type
param.label: Count Type
param.help: the type of counts to use -- must be a name in the counts slot (`moo@counts`)

param.name: norm_type
param.label: Normalization Type
param.help: normalization type. Default: "voom" which uses `limma::voom`.

param.name: feature_id_colname
param.label: Feature ID Column
param.help: The column from the counts data containing the Feature IDs (Usually Gene or Protein ID). This is usually the first column of your input Counts Matrix. Only columns of Text type from your input Counts Matrix will be available to select for this parameter. (Default: `NULL` - first column in the counts matrix will be used.)

param.name: value
param.label: Value
param.help: Which samples would you like to include? Usually, you will choose all sample columns, or you could choose to remove certain samples. Samples excluded here will be removed in this step and from further analysis downstream of this step. (Default: `NULL` - all sample IDs in `moo@sample_meta` will be used.)

param.name: sample_id_colname
param.label: Sample Names Column
param.help: The column from the sample metadata containing the sample names. The names in this column must exactly match the names used as the sample column names of your input Counts Matrix. (Default: `NULL` - first column in the sample metadata will be used.)

param.name: group_colname
param.label: Groups Column
param.help: The column from the sample metadata containing the sample group information. This is usually a column showing to which experimental treatments each sample belongs (e.g. WildType, Knockout, Tumor, Normal, Before, After, etc.).

param.name: label_colname
param.label: Labels Column
param.help: The column from the sample metadata containing the sample labels as you wish them to appear in the plots produced by this template. This can be the same Sample Names Column. However, you may desire different labels to display on your figure (e.g. shorter labels are sometimes preferred on plots). In that case, select the column with your preferred Labels here. The selected column should contain unique names for each sample. (Default: `NULL` -- `sample_id_colname` will be used.)

param.name: input_in_log_counts
param.label: Input in Log Counts
param.help: set this to `TRUE` if counts are already log2-transformed

param.name: voom_normalization_method
param.label: Normalization Method
param.help: Normalization method to be applied to the logCPM values when using `limma::voom`

repeat.name: samples_to_rename_repeat
repeat.title: Samples to Rename Manually on PCA

param.name: value
param.label: Value
param.help: If you do not have a Plot Labels Column in your sample metadata table, you can use this parameter to rename samples manually for display on the PCA plot. Use "Add item" to add each additional sample for renaming. Use the following format to describe which old name (in your sample metadata table) you want to rename to which new name: old_name: new_name

param.name: add_label_to_pca
param.label: Add Labels to PCA
param.help: label points on the PCA plot

param.name: principal_component_on_x_axis
param.label: Principal Component on X-axis for PCA
param.help: The principal component to plot on the x-axis for the PCA plot. Choices include 1, 2, 3, ... (default: 1)

param.name: principal_component_on_y_axis
param.label: Principal Component on Y-axis for PCA
param.help: The principal component to plot on the y-axis for the PCA plot. Choices include 1, 2, 3, ... (default: 2)

param.name: legend_position_for_pca
param.label: Legend position for PCA
param.help: legend position for the PCA plot

param.name: label_offset_x_
param.label: Label Offset (x) for PCA
param.help: label offset x for the PCA plot

param.name: label_offset_y_
param.label: Label Offset (y) for PCA
param.help: label offset y for the PCA plot

param.name: label_font_size
param.label: Label Font Size for PCA
param.help: label font size for the PCA plot

param.name: point_size_for_pca
param.label: Point Size for PCA
param.help: geom point size for the PCA plot

param.name: color_histogram_by_group
param.label: Color Histogram by Group
param.help: Set to FALSE to label histogram by Sample Names, or set to TRUE to label histogram by the column you select in the "Group Column Used to Color Histogram" parameter (below). Default is FALSE.

param.name: maximum_for_x_axis_for_histogram
param.label: Maximum for X-axis in Histogram
param.help: x-axis maximum for histogram plot

param.name: minimum_for_x_axis_for_histogram
param.label: Minimum for X-axis in Histogram
param.help: x-axis minimum for histogram plot

param.name: set_min_max_for_x_axis_for_histogram
param.label: Set Min/Max for X-axis for Histogram
param.help: whether to set min/max value for histogram x-axis

param.name: legend_font_size_for_histogram
param.label: Legend Font Size for Histogram
param.help: legend font size for the histogram plot

param.name: legend_position_for_histogram
param.label: Legend Position for Histogram
param.help: legend position for the histogram plot. consider setting to 'none' for a large number of samples.

param.name: number_of_histogram_legend_columns
param.label: Number of Histogram Legend Columns
param.help: number of columns for the histogram legend

param.name: colors_for_plots
param.label: Colors for Plots
param.help: Colors for the PCA and histogram will be picked, in order, from this list. Colors must either be names in `grDevices::colors()` or valid hex codes.

param.name: interactive_plots
param.label: Make Plots Interactive
param.help: set to TRUE to make PCA and Histogram plots interactive with `plotly`, allowing you to hover your mouse over a point or line to view sample information. The similarity heat map will not display if this toggle is set to `TRUE`. Default is `FALSE`.

param.name: save_plots
param.label: Save Plots
param.help: Whether to save plots to files during analysis (Defaults to `TRUE`, overwritable using option 'moo_save_plots' or environment variable 'MOO_SAVE_PLOTS')

param.name: plot_corr_matrix_heatmap
param.label: Plot Correlation Matrix Heatmap
param.help: Datasets with a large number of samples may be too large to create a correlation matrix heatmap. If this function takes longer than 5 minutes to run, Set to `FALSE` and the correlation matrix will not be be created. Default is `TRUE`.

tool.help:
**Normalization**
Runs `MOSuite::normalize_counts()` - https://ccbr.github.io/MOSuite/reference/normalize_counts.html`
Normalize counts
**Outputs:**
- multiOmicDataSet: file (moo.rds) - figures: directory (figures/norm/)
